body:
Comment 6: 
I deeply regret having to mangle a perfectly good piece of code that has a long
heritage. However, I support the idea of always compiling with -Werror and think that
the extra debugging Clang gives adds value in the majority of circumstances. 

Given the choice between adding another special flag for Clang (or whatever
compiler.next) and making a change to one file, I think the latter is the best choice.
_Labels changed: added **priority-later**, removed **priority-triage**._ _Owner changed to @davecheney._ _Status changed to **Started**._
